messages.description: Usage message for the program. {0} is the program name.
messages.C: Usage: {0} [file...]

messages.description: Label for a Note - extra information associated with a message
messages.C: Note

messages.description: Label for an Info message - informational message which is not a warning/error
messages.C: Information

messages.description: Label for a Warning - code issue which isn't an error but can produce a 'code-smell'.
messages.C: Warning

messages.description: Label for an Error - error in the code, but compilation can attempt to continue.
messages.C: Error

messages.description: Label for a fatal error - an error in the code which stops compilation immediately.
messages.C: Serious Error

messages.description: Label for an internal compiler error - error in the compiler itself.
messages.C: INTERNAL COMPILER ERROR

messages.description: Name to give the file that represents the command line.
messages.C: (command line)

messages.description: Name to give the file that represents the standard input
messages.C: (standard input)

messages.description: Too many errors have occured, stopping compilation. {0} is the number of errors.
messages.C: Too many errors (have seen {0} error reports).

messages.description: Error whilst trying to read from a file, {0} is the file, {1} is the error message
messages.C: File handling error in {0}: {1}

messages.description: Missing new line at end of non-empty file. (C2018-5.1.1.2-1-2)
messages.C: Missing new line at end of non-empty file (C2018-5.1.1.2-1-2).

messages.description: We have a splice ('\' followed by newline) immediately followed by end of file.  This is not permitted by C2018-5.1.1.2-1-2.
messages.C: '\' followed by newline, may not be the last characters in a file (C2018-5.1.1.2-1-2).

messages.description: We have a malformed UTF-8 character, shouldn't start with 0x80.
messages.C: Malformed UTF-8 character.  Shouldn't start with top-two bits set to 0x80.

messages.description: We have a malformed UTF-8 character, ran out of continuation characters too early.
messages.C: Malformed UTF-8 character.  Not enough continuation characters before next character start.

messages.description: We have a malformed UTF-8 character, ran out of continuation characters before the end of the line.
messages.C: Malformed UTF-8 character.  Not enough continuation characters before the end of the line.

messages.description: We have replaced the trigraph character sequence '??{0}' with {1}, this may be a surprise.  How this happens is described in C2018-5.1.1.2-1-1 and C2018-5.2.1.1-1.
messages.C: Trigraph character sequence encountered.  '??{0}' has been replaced by '{1}' (see C2018-5.1.1.2-1-1 and C2018-5.2.1.1-1).  This behaviour is deprecated, and not applied in C++20.

messages.description: A line comment (//) has not been terminated by a newline character.  Usually by end of include or source.  This should not occur in normal use, as the NewlineChewer would have ensured we have newlines at end of lines.
messages.C: Line comment (// ...) needs a terminating newline.

messages.description: A multi-line comment (/* */) has not been terminated before the end of a file.
messages.C: Multi-line commnet (/* */) has not been terminated correctly.

messages.description: Using a Unicode character outside the basic character set is implementation defined behaviour. {0} has the character used.  C2018-6.4.2.1.
messages.C: The character {0} is not in the basic character set.  Using it directly in an identifier is implementation defined behaviour.  See C2018-6.4.2.1.

messages.description: We were passing a string of hex digits and there were not as many as expected.  {0} is how many characters were expected {1} is how many we got.
messages.C: Not enough hex digits found.  Expected {0} found {1}.

messages.description: The escape sequence \{0} is not recognised.
messages.C: Unrecognised escape sequence: \{0}.

messages.description: A literal quote is not valid in a character literal.
messages.C: A literal quote is not valid in a character literal, use \' instead.  (C2018-6.4.4.4)

messages.description: A character literal must not be empty. (C2018-6.4.4.4)
messages.C: A character literal must not be empty. (C2018-6.4.4.4)

messages.description: A literal newline is not valid in a character literal. (C2018-6.4.4.4)
messages.C: A literal newline is not valid in a character literal, use \n instead. (C2018-6.4.4.4)

messages.description: A character literal describes only one character. (C2018-6.4.4.4)
messages.C: Too many characters in the character literal. (C2018-6.4.4.4)

messages.description: Could not find closing ' for character literal.. (C2018-6.4.4.4)
messages.C: Could not find closing \' for character literal. (C2018-6.4.4.4)

messages.description: Character literal is out of range.  {0} is value of literal, {1} is max value allowed.
messages.C: Character literal is out of range.  Given value '\x{0:x}' is not in the range [0, 0x{1:x}].
